This is an article I wrote.

Improve your mood
You may not be able to incorporate all of them into your life, try to pick  
at least two or three and then use them on a daily or weekly basis.

1.                                             Give Thanks

Being grateful for what you have in your life can make you happier. Studies  
have shown that people who express gratitude at least 1-3 times a week, are  
much happier than people who are not grateful for what they have.
So take a few days each week to think or write about the things you are  
grateful for in your life.


2.                                                 Monitor Your Thoughts



Most people replay the same negative thoughts over and over again. These  
thoughts can cause a person to become depressed, anxious and stressed.

Next time you have one of these repeating negative thoughts, write it down  
on paper. Then ask yourself, is this thought making you feel bad? Where did  
you learn this thought from? Is this thought true?

By analysing your negative thoughts, you may be able to come up with  
something more positive to replace it with. Keep repeating that new  
thought, and eventually you will shed you old negative


3.                                                        Don’t Dwell On  
The Past

Sometimes it’s better not to spend time worrying about mistakes you made in  
the past, or mistakes you might make in the future. Thinking about either  
of these can make you anxious about the future, or prolong a depression  
from the past.

If you find yourself worrying about things in the past, present or future,  
distract yourself by doing something constructive instead. For example,  
play with your pet, do some exercise or go out with your friends.


acting in a way you would like to be can have a positive impact on your  
mood.





4.                                   Stay away from negative people

Being around negative unhappy people can bring you down, and make you feel  
equally unhappy. Negative energy is infectious, but so is positive energy.

So to improve your mood, spend as much time as you can around the happy  
people in your life.

Be Careful Who You Hang Around




5.                                                                  Exercise

People who suffer from depression are usually very shallow breathers.  
Running and meditation can both help to encourage deep diaphragmatic belly  
breathing.

By breathing deeply you cause the release of certain neurotransmitters in  
the brain, that are associated with happy calm feelings and reduced levels  
of stress.



6.                                                                   Drink  
Pure Water

Dehydration can make you feel tired and lazy, but water can help to restore  
your energy levels. The most common times people are dehydrated are in the  
morning and after exercise. So make sure you drink some filtered water when  
you wake up, and before and after exercising.






7.                                                          Buy Yourself A  
Gift

A study found that women who bought themselves flowers, reported feeling  
happier and less anxious than those who did not. So if you are feeling  
down, take your mind off your worries and treat yourself!




8.                                                              Listen To  
Some Music

Listening to your favourite tunes can almost instantly put you in a good  
mood, and the positive effects can last long after the music is over.


Listening to music you like can affect the pleasure center of the brain,  
the same area that’s activated when you have an orgasm.

8.                                                                Smell  
Something

Smelling a scent that appeals to you can improve your mood. This occurs  
because the areas of the brain that process smell and emotion are linked,  
so the functioning of one area directly affects the other.

After you have been exposed to a scent for around 20 minutes you will no  
longer smell it, but the good mood will stick around.



9.                                                            Watch A Funny  
Movie

We all know that watching a funny movie can be a good way to improve your  
mood, but did you know that laughing is good for you?

Research has shown that laughing not only helps to reduce stress, but also  
makes the body healthier by increasing the number of immune cells.




10.                                              Get Some Sun & Go To Park

Sunlight is an excellent way to get some vitamin D, but it can also improve  
your mood. Researchers have found that depression is most common during the  
winter months when sunlight is scarce, and in people who stay indoors all  
the time.

Sunlight helps to increase serotonin levels in the brain, which is an  
important mood chemical and can also help you to sleep better.

However don’t over do it. Aim for around 10-20 minutes in the sun at least  
3 times a week, and don’t wear sunscreen otherwise you won’t get the  
benefits.



10.                                                                  Get A  
Pet

Research has found that cat owners are less likely to suffer from heart  
attacks than those who do not have cats.

Cat, and pet owners in general, are more likely to feel happier and be in a  
good mood throughout the day, than those who do not have any pets.

Although the exact reasons for this are unknown, it is believed that  
stroking an animals fur is calming to the nervous system and can therefore  
help to reduce stress levels and improve your mood.
